intro: Comastoma acutum, commonly known as the narrowleaf comastoma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Comastoma acutum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
